column4: okay this is another question related to the computer that I am working with...
it says that I have 3000MB and that I need 5000MB
is there a version of ubuntu where I can install with less memory because I am deleting all of the files to make more memory
64mb may not do it; fluxbuntu perhaps but even that is a stretch
not your hdd, need to add ram
you are referring to hard drive space; though with 64mb of ram it is a moot point
you have kubuntu installed successfully with only 64mb of ram?
no I am trying to install
no way kubuntu will install on that tiny amount of ram
is adding ram just not an option? you insist on running that system as is?
